node.title: Georgia election worker's lawsuit claims strangers twice tried to enter grandmother's home to perform a 'citizen's arrest'
node.alt: Donald Trump on the phone as he sits at his Oval Office desk
node.description: Two Georgia election workers filed a defamation lawsuit on Thursday against a conservative website, accusing it of knowingly publishing and spreading false stories, saying the workers hadÂ engaged in ballot fraud during the 2020 general election.
node.content:
["Two Georgia election workers have filed a defamation lawsuit accusing conservative US website The Gateway Pundit\u00a0of knowingly publishing false stories\u00a0that said\u00a0the workers had\u00a0engaged in ballot fraud during the 2020 general election.", "On Thursday, local time, Fulton County elections workers Ruby Freeman and Wandrea \"Shaye\" Moss, a mother and daughter, filed the lawsuit against the news website, its owner, Jim Hoft, and his brother, Joe Hoft, a contributor to the site.", "Among other things, the lawsuit says the website and the Hofts conducted a \"campaign of lies\" that led to online and in-person harassment against the two women.", "Those alleged falsehoods \"have not only devastated their personal and professional reputations but instigated a deluge of intimidation, harassment\u00a0and threats that have\u00a0forced them to change their phone numbers, delete their online accounts\u00a0and fear for their physical safety\", the lawsuit says.", "Attempts to contact The Gateway Pundit and the Hofts were unsuccessful.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
Gateway\u00a0Pundit\u00a0publisher Jim Hoft has been accused of perpetuating claims about the two women even after those claims\u00a0had been disproved.(Reuters:\u00a0Carlos Barria)
", "Angered by his narrow loss in a traditionally Republican state, former president Donald Trump focused intense scrutiny on Georgia, making unproven claims that widespread fraud there led to his loss in the state.", "A representative from Mr Trump's legal team, Jacki Pick, spoke before a Georgia state Senate committee on December\u00a03, 2020, and showed part of a surveillance video from the room where ballots were counted at State Farm Arena in Atlanta.", "Ms Pick told the committee\u00a0that Republican observers were asked to leave the room late on election night and that, once they were gone, election workers pulled out and counted hidden, fraudulent ballots.", "She did not name the election workers in the video \"but said 'one of them had the name Ruby across her shirt somewhere'\",\u00a0the lawsuit says.", "Later that day, The Gateway Pundit was the first outlet to publish Ms Freeman's full name and, in a subsequent story, it also identified Ms Moss, the lawsuit says.", "The allegation that \"suitcases\" of ballots were pulled from under tables away from the eyes of observers was almost immediately debunked.", "However, the allegation\u00a0continues to circulate among supporters of the former president and others who say the election was marred by fraud.", "The Gateway Pundit and the Hofts perpetuated the debunked narrative, publishing stories and promoting them on social media, even after they were aware it had been disproved, the lawsuit says.", "Among other things, the suit says, their stories accused Ms Freeman and Ms Moss of conspiring to get observers out of a room where ballots were being counted, adding illegal ballots to the count and running the same ballots through scanners multiple times.", "In a phone call with Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger on January\u00a02, Mr Trump pressed the Republican official to \"find\" votes for him and mentioned Ms Freeman by name, calling her \"a vote-scammer, a professional vote-scammer and hustler\".", "Ms Freeman worked as a temporary election worker during the 2020 election, verifying signatures on absentee ballots and preparing them to be counted and processed.", "She worked for the Fulton County elections department since 2012 and supervised the absentee ballot operation during last year's election.", "", "
The Trump team has so far been unable to back up its claims of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 US election.\u00a0(Reuters: Bryan Woolston)
", "As the allegations against her began to spread, Ms Freeman received hundreds of emails, dozens of text messages and threatening phone calls, and strangers showed up at her house, the lawsuit says.", "The FBI concluded on January\u00a06 that she wouldn't be safe in her home, and she relocated for two months.", "She had to abandon her pop-up clothing boutique because she had to close its social media accounts and couldn't attend events in person.", "Ms Moss' teenage son was bombarded with threatening and racist messages after harassers found her old phone number, which he had taken over, the lawsuit says.", "Because she had previously lived with her grandmother, the suit says, strangers showed up at her grandmother's house at least twice and tried to enter to make a \"citizen's arrest\".", "Ms Moss used to enjoy the parts of her job that involved interacting with the public but now becomes anxious if they ask her name, the lawsuit says.", "Their lawsuit was filed in a circuit court in St\u00a0Louis, where The Gateway Pundit is based. It is seeking\u00a0compensatory and punitive damages, as well as legal costs.", "It also asks a judge to declare that the statements published by the website and the Hofts and mentioned in the suit are false and to order the false and defamatory statements removed from any website or social media accounts they control.", "AP"]
